intro: Lastrea ligulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lastrea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting well to poor soil conditions. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
